questionTitle: When the manager went to Canada on business his ________ took over all his duties.
He saw the plane crash into the sea when its engines ________.
You are going to come to the party, ________?
You will never finish that job by tomorrow morning unless you ________ some help.
It's difficult to pay one's bills when prices keep ________.
After the death of her mother, Diana was brought ________ by her aunt.
But why did the police suspect you? It just does not make ________ to me.
When she heard that her son had crossed the road without looking, she told him he ________ do it again.
He went to Australia hoping to find a teaching ________ without too much difficulty.
I can't ________ what he's doing; it's so dark down there.
We have ________ good transport in my country.
I'd like you to meet a very good friend of ________, Alan Davis.
They travelled to Spain by the most ________ route.
The film was based ________ a novel by Dickens.
I should be grateful ________ any advice you can give.
I was shocked ________ his indifference!
The Director has just gone on his ________ leave. He gets four weeks' holiday a year and he is taking it all at the same time. So if you wish to see him, come back in a moment's time.
They have ________ this minute left for the station.
To my ________, inflation is a far greater danger than nuclear arms.
Mr and Mrs Hudson are always ________ with each other about money.
